items.text: I enjoy being in charge and making decisions for others.
items.rationale: Desire for control and leadership is central to Authority.

items.text: People often look to me for guidance and direction.
items.rationale: Being seen as a leader is a key aspect of Authority.

items.text: I feel comfortable taking the lead in group settings.
items.rationale: Comfort with leadership roles is indicative of Authority.

items.text: I believe I have a natural talent for leadership.
items.rationale: Self-perception of leadership ability aligns with Authority.

items.text: I often find myself in positions where I have to make important decisions.
items.rationale: Frequent decision-making roles suggest Authority.

items.text: I like to be the one who sets the rules.
items.rationale: Preference for rule-setting is a sign of Authority.

items.text: I am confident in my ability to lead others.
items.rationale: Confidence in leadership is a core aspect of Authority.

items.text: I often take charge in situations where others hesitate.
items.rationale: Taking charge is a behavior associated with Authority.

items.text: I enjoy having control over the outcome of situations.
items.rationale: Desire for control is indicative of Authority.

items.text: I am often the one who makes the final decision.
items.rationale: Being the decision-maker is a trait of Authority.

items.text: I feel that I am a natural leader.
items.rationale: Self-identification as a leader is central to Authority.

items.text: I like to be in control of situations.
items.rationale: Preference for control is a key aspect of Authority.

items.text: I sometimes feel that others should follow my lead.
items.rationale: Desire for others to follow can indicate Authority but may also suggest a need for validation.

items.text: I often find myself in leadership roles, even if I don't seek them out.
items.rationale: Being placed in leadership roles suggests Authority, but could also be due to external factors.

items.text: I like to be the center of attention in group settings.
items.rationale: Desire for attention could map to Exhibitionism as well as Authority.

items.text: I deserve more than others.
items.rationale: Belief in deserving more is a core aspect of Entitlement.

items.text: I often feel that I am owed special treatment.
items.rationale: Feeling owed special treatment is indicative of Entitlement.

items.text: I expect others to go out of their way to accommodate me.
items.rationale: Expectation of special accommodation is a sign of Entitlement.

items.text: I believe I am more deserving than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in being more deserving is central to Entitlement.

items.text: I often feel that I should receive preferential treatment.
items.rationale: Desire for preferential treatment is indicative of Entitlement.

items.text: I think I am entitled to more than others.
items.rationale: Feeling entitled to more is a key aspect of Entitlement.

items.text: I often feel that I deserve more recognition than I get.
items.rationale: Desire for more recognition is a sign of Entitlement.

items.text: I expect others to treat me as someone special.
items.rationale: Expectation of special treatment is central to Entitlement.

items.text: I feel that I am entitled to certain privileges.
items.rationale: Feeling entitled to privileges is indicative of Entitlement.

items.text: I often feel that I should be given more opportunities than others.
items.rationale: Desire for more opportunities is a sign of Entitlement.

items.text: I believe I am entitled to success.
items.rationale: Belief in being entitled to success is central to Entitlement.

items.text: I often feel that I deserve more than what I have.
items.rationale: Feeling deserving of more can indicate Entitlement but may also reflect dissatisfaction.

items.text: I sometimes think that others should recognize my worth more.
items.rationale: Desire for recognition can suggest Entitlement but may also relate to self-esteem.

items.text: I like to be admired by others.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration could map to Vanity as well as Entitlement.

items.text: I enjoy showing off my accomplishments.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of displaying achievements is central to Exhibitionism.

items.text: I like to be the center of attention.
items.rationale: Desire for attention is a key aspect of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I often find myself talking about my successes.
items.rationale: Talking about successes is indicative of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I enjoy being in the spotlight.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of being in the spotlight is a sign of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I like to make a big impression on others.
items.rationale: Desire to impress is central to Exhibitionism.

items.text: I often feel the need to show off my talents.
items.rationale: Need to display talents is indicative of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I enjoy being the focus of attention.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of attention is a key aspect of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I like to be noticed by others.
items.rationale: Desire to be noticed is a sign of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I often find myself in the center of social gatherings.
items.rationale: Being the center of gatherings is indicative of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I enjoy drawing attention to myself.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of attention is central to Exhibitionism.

items.text: I like to be the life of the party.
items.rationale: Desire to be the life of the party is a key aspect of Exhibitionism.

items.text: I often feel the need to be in the limelight.
items.rationale: Need for limelight suggests Exhibitionism but may also relate to social confidence.

items.text: I sometimes go out of my way to be noticed.
items.rationale: Efforts to be noticed can indicate Exhibitionism but may also reflect social anxiety.

items.text: I like to be admired for my achievements.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration could map to Vanity as well as Exhibitionism.

items.text: I am willing to manipulate others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Willingness to manipulate is central to Exploitativeness.

items.text: I often use others to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Using others for personal gain is indicative of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I am good at getting people to do what I want.
items.rationale: Skill in influencing others is a sign of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I often take advantage of others to get ahead.
items.rationale: Taking advantage of others is central to Exploitativeness.

items.text: I am skilled at persuading others to do things for me.
items.rationale: Persuasion for personal benefit is indicative of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I often find ways to use others to my advantage.
items.rationale: Using others for advantage is a key aspect of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I am comfortable using others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Comfort with using others is a sign of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I often manipulate situations to benefit myself.
items.rationale: Manipulating situations for personal gain is central to Exploitativeness.

items.text: I am often able to get others to do what I want.
items.rationale: Ability to influence others is indicative of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I often use charm to get my way.
items.rationale: Using charm for personal gain is a key aspect of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I am often able to turn situations to my advantage.
items.rationale: Turning situations to one's advantage is a sign of Exploitativeness.

items.text: I sometimes use others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Occasional use of others suggests Exploitativeness but may also reflect opportunism.

items.text: I occasionally manipulate others to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Manipulation for goals suggests Exploitativeness but may also relate to assertiveness.

items.text: I like to be in control of situations.
items.rationale: Desire for control could map to Authority as well as Exploitativeness.

items.text: I prefer to rely on myself rather than others.
items.rationale: Preference for self-reliance is central to Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I am comfortable handling things on my own.
items.rationale: Comfort with independence is indicative of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I often take care of things myself rather than ask for help.
items.rationale: Handling tasks independently is a sign of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I believe I can handle most situations on my own.
items.rationale: Belief in personal capability is central to Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I prefer to solve my own problems.
items.rationale: Preference for personal problem-solving is indicative of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I am confident in my ability to manage on my own.
items.rationale: Confidence in independence is a key aspect of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I often rely on myself to get things done.
items.rationale: Reliance on self is a sign of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I am self-reliant and prefer it that way.
items.rationale: Self-reliance is central to Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I often find solutions to my problems without help.
items.rationale: Finding solutions independently is indicative of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I am comfortable being independent.
items.rationale: Comfort with independence is a key aspect of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I prefer to be self-sufficient.
items.rationale: Preference for self-sufficiency is a sign of Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I sometimes prefer to handle things on my own.
items.rationale: Occasional preference for independence suggests Self-Sufficiency but may also reflect introversion.

items.text: I occasionally find it easier to do things myself.
items.rationale: Preference for doing things oneself suggests Self-Sufficiency but may also relate to efficiency.

items.text: I like to be in control of my own life.
items.rationale: Desire for control could map to Authority as well as Self-Sufficiency.

items.text: I often feel that I am better than others.
items.rationale: Belief in being better is central to Superiority.

items.text: I believe I am more capable than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in greater capability is indicative of Superiority.

items.text: I often feel that I am more talented than others.
items.rationale: Belief in superior talent is a sign of Superiority.

items.text: I believe I am more intelligent than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in superior intelligence is central to Superiority.

items.text: I often feel that I am more successful than others.
items.rationale: Belief in greater success is indicative of Superiority.

items.text: I believe I am more important than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in greater importance is a key aspect of Superiority.

items.text: I often feel that I am more accomplished than others.
items.rationale: Belief in greater accomplishments is a sign of Superiority.

items.text: I believe I am more knowledgeable than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in superior knowledge is central to Superiority.

items.text: I often feel that I am more skilled than others.
items.rationale: Belief in superior skills is indicative of Superiority.

items.text: I believe I am more deserving of success than others.
items.rationale: Belief in greater deservingness is a key aspect of Superiority.

items.text: I often feel that I am more competent than others.
items.rationale: Belief in greater competence is a sign of Superiority.

items.text: I sometimes feel that I am better than others.
items.rationale: Occasional belief in being better suggests Superiority but may also reflect confidence.

items.text: I occasionally think that I am more capable than others.
items.rationale: Belief in greater capability suggests Superiority but may also relate to self-esteem.

items.text: I like to be admired for my intelligence.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration could map to Vanity as well as Superiority.

items.text: I often admire my own appearance in the mirror.
items.rationale: Admiration of one's appearance is central to Vanity.

items.text: I take great pride in my physical appearance.
items.rationale: Pride in appearance is indicative of Vanity.

items.text: I often feel that I am more attractive than others.
items.rationale: Belief in superior attractiveness is a sign of Vanity.

items.text: I enjoy receiving compliments about my looks.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of compliments on appearance is central to Vanity.

items.text: I often spend time enhancing my appearance.
items.rationale: Efforts to enhance appearance are indicative of Vanity.

items.text: I believe I am more physically appealing than most people.
items.rationale: Belief in superior physical appeal is a key aspect of Vanity.

items.text: I often feel proud of my appearance.
items.rationale: Pride in appearance is a sign of Vanity.

items.text: I enjoy looking at myself in the mirror.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of one's reflection is central to Vanity.

items.text: I often receive compliments on my looks.
items.rationale: Receiving compliments on appearance is indicative of Vanity.

items.text: I take pride in my grooming and style.
items.rationale: Pride in grooming and style is a key aspect of Vanity.

items.text: I often feel that I am more stylish than others.
items.rationale: Belief in superior style is a sign of Vanity.

items.text: I sometimes admire my own appearance.
items.rationale: Occasional self-admiration suggests Vanity but may also reflect self-esteem.

items.text: I occasionally feel proud of my looks.
items.rationale: Pride in looks suggests Vanity but may also relate to confidence.

items.text: I like to be admired for my appearance.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration could map to Exhibitionism as well as Vanity.
